title: Ticket #6785: Starter should assume shadow on same machine has trustable UID_DOMAIN
description:
On a machine that doesn't have working DNS or is configured to be a personal Condor (using interface 127.0.0.1), it's easy for UID_DOMAIN (default $(FULL_HOSTNAME)) to not match the hostname associated with the network interface used between the starter and shadow. This causes the starter to run the job as user nobody. If file transfer isn't enabled, this is likely to fail, as nobody won't have permission to access the job's files. If the starter and shadow are on the same machine, it's reasonable to assume they share the same UID namespace.

Add a new knob, TRUST_LOCAL_UID_DOMAIN. If it's true (the default) and the shadow's end of the TCP connection is on a local network interface, then the starter doesn't do the matching test between UID_DOMAIN and the hostname of that interface. This is the same as TRUST_UID_DOMAIN, but only for shadows on the same machine. We should still do the matching of UID_DOMAIN values between starter and shadow, as that makes testing easier.
